Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2013 10:24AM juneaubugg wrote: AEM47: SHIT!!!!! Butterfly: yes PFC. I kept all my brows and lashes (think I might add) throughout 4 rounds of AC. Lashes came out totally 3 weeks PFC; brows started thining then but never totally came out. I started using Brian Joseph. Google it. It's by a woman who underwent chemo. My lashes and brows came back quickly. I still use it. Maybe that will keep them from dropping again. *sigh*. This fucking cancer shit.... How many years until this ends?! Fucking poisoning ourselves to save ourselves. So insanity not fair to add hair loss. Why doesnt chemo for men's cancers cause hair loss?!?! So not fair! I am just really REALLY irritated with the hair, the weight gain, hot flashes, loss to sensation in my chest and back of my arm... Anything else coming my way or am I done yet?! Argh! Sorry... SO CRANKY from this damn "lifestyle change". I want SUGAR and CARBS!!!!

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 01:31PM juneaubugg wrote: skigirl72; hang in there.  I did he exact same thing.  Bra strap length hair.  Whatever you do, if you wait for it to come out like I did in the tub, don't look before you shave it.  My DH got the clippers and started shaving when he found me crying in the tub when what little I had left following my buzz cut, came out in clumps. I am so grateful I don'thave that image stuck in my head. Of patches of hair just gone.  As you can guess by the photo, it was pretty emotional for me, as I am sure it is for all of us. Hang in there sister, it'll be back.  Just focus on the oral hygine and water right now.  Most important things. I go thrush after my 3rd tx becuase I slacked on rinsing with baking soda, salt and warm water afer every meal.  I was just so fed up with it.  boy did I pay for it.

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2013 10:18PM juneaubugg wrote: My hair is just crazy curly. I found a product to control it so I can comb it back at the side of my head rather then go Afro chic. It's called M.O.P.(modern organic products) Curl Enhancing System. Make sure you get the right one. It's in a 5.1 ounce pump. I love it... I'm just letting it grow. I reversed it out in February and haven't touched it since. Luckily I wasn't grey before, but I dyed my hair wine coed for many years just for fun. Now I'm just letting grow... Impatiently! 10/10/12 was my last treatment. I've been dog biotin all along too. Damn curls make it look shorter. And I think it's a little thicker too!

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 10:38AM juneaubugg wrote: Hi ladies! I'm 5 1/2 weeks PFC. I've been reading this thread for a couple of weeks with total hair envy!! My niece said I feel like a peach, but I think I'm a bit fuzzier!! I'm really upset that after four rounds of AC (2 weeks PFC) my eyelashes and eyebrows started coming out. I got the Brian Joesph and my lashes are growing back, but my damn brows keep thining. Luckily there is new stubble under them I can use as a guide to draw them in. Anyway, just thought I'd make myself known. I get my squishys in 12 days. Maybe then I'll just have hair envy instead if hair AND boob envy! But he'll I'm almost 45 and I had body envy before this even started. Oh to be a size 6 again. *sigh*

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2013 07:56AM - edited Feb 27, 2013 07:56AM by juneaubugg Victoria: like dltnhm I never really felt the wig, so I never wore it. I was topless at 8 weeks. I didn't get my first trim until about 24 weeks. I get my third Friday. We trim from around the ears and below. Just letting the rest fill in and grow out. Filling in takes time, but no I didn't touch the top whilst it did/does. Hang in there... The hair loss was the most demoralizing part for me. I felt striped bare before the world. When I finally said F-it and just took the cap off I got my self confidence back. Now I ware a cap because my head gets so cold, but I leave a little hair sticking out in Front. It's like in need to be sure people know I'm not bald... Funny thing is; who would actually THINK THAT?! "Oh I bet she's bald under there". Lol! Chemo really does drive you CRAZY! My last tx was October 10, 2012; my avatar was taken two weeks ago.

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2013 09:37AM juneaubugg wrote: patriciahurtado: yes I am pretty sure you can take biotin now. Just confirm with your MO. All: those are indeed my lashes. Telling you ... Buy the Brian Joseph's. it's pricy but I'm just finishing my first tube. Wish I had known to use if before they fell out, but seeing as I had them through AC I did t think they fall out AFTER. but hey, I should stop expecting anything with this disease huh? Kj: good to know in not the only one growing in straight, thick and yes SOFT SOFT SOFT! Like a baby's hair!!! I like to pet myself. Lol. Friends ask to feel it all the time too. As for that crazy middle stage I'll be in For months....fuck it is what I say. I went topless about five weeks PFC. I don't care anymore. I'm a survivor. This is who I am now. Let the world SEE. I'm alive and to me that makes me just beautiful no matter how my hair looks. It's on top of my head, and as my mother says.... I'm grateful to be on the right side of the grass today! Per my beautiful necklace. My DH picked put for me at my friends Aunts shop when we visited his inlaws this summer when I was just a week out of my 3rd AC. it was. A tough trip for me. Anyway, if you're ever in Wilmington NC, it's a small shopping the Cotton Exchange in downtown. It's the last shop downstairs on the left when you enter the marketplace. They have beautiful jewelry. And this piece was inexpensive too. Only $60. If you're ever near its worth stopping in.

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2013 12:58PM juneaubugg wrote: iamNancy: Good for you! I tried to wear wigs. I lasted one week when I went back to work. Couldn't stand them!!! I'm one year PFC now (almost to the day - 10/10/12). My hair is super curly - (was long and wavy before). I use MOP C-System Curl Enhancing Cream to keep the curls from being unruly while it grows in. It seems to be starting to straighten now near my scalp. My hairdresser told me last week to just keep waiting it out. She trimmed me up and evened me off about 6 months out. I agree with everyone else - take photos so you can see the progress. Otherwise it just seems like it's never going to come back. I look at Carols photos and get hope. It's grown so much since last year! Although my hair was always a bit slow to grow.... *sigh*

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2013 09:00AM - edited Feb 12, 2013 09:05AM by juneaubugg indenial; like mdg said, you are in the worst part of it. I also thought about ALL those things. its totally normal. this is a JOURNEY NOT AN EVENT. you will not get one answer, one treatment, and be done. there are tests, surgery, more tests, maybe chemo... maybe radiation... usually hormone therapy.... we are all different and our journeys are all little different. I remember when I got my diagnosis I landed her at the BCO website... THANK GOD. its all I've ever needed. stay away from Dr google and statistics.... WE ARE ALL DIFFERENT. I remember having the abbreviation page book marked at first so I could understand things. I remember checking to see if there were any responses to my posts every fifteen minutes. I was like someone who just crossed the desert, and information/responses were like water to me... and I was desperate. WE ALL GET IT, AND YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE. Find a forum or two on here and call it home. take the journey with other newly diagnosed women and find one where women can tell you what worked for them. you will have choices all along the way, you don't need to decide right now about recon or not. your BS (breast surgeon) and, if you see one... your choice, PS (plastic surgeon) will be able to help you decide what surgery is right for you (i was able to have a skin and nipple sparing mastectomy with reconstruction...i didn't know such surgical options were available until after my consult. i thought it was lumpectomy or mastectomy; so just wait) and if there is a reconstruction method you would like to have... or not. if not, they can steer you to specialty bra shops to aid you in prosthetics and they have bras that hold them. (do keep in mind you will need specialty bathing suits too). there will be so much you will learn, and I would suggest you get that education here. add you get more information from your drs come here and ask questions, read forums, learn from others who have the experience. I got all my questions to ask my drs here. they were always surprised by hours much I knew to ask about. and most importantly, this place was my lifeline. my drs gave me ativan and xanax for the anxiety, I took pain meds for the surgeries and yes, the biopsies fucking hurt... but the emotional isolation, not being able to explain to family and friends, in any way they could really understand, how it felt to be me... I found relief from that here. so I'm SO SORRY you have landed here, but you ate so lucky you found us. welcome... and hold on its going to be a bumpy ride... BUT YOU WILL SURVIVE, and perhaps welcome someone who is scared, confused and looking for answers a year from now. I like what Golden said too.... keep breathing. most days it really is that simple. feel free to PM (private message) me if you'd like, or have more questions. I may have answers, I may not, but I'll try... (((hugs)))
Posts.Title: Please tell me I will survive this. indenial sutherndiva
